title: HTML Essentials
author: qwerType Academy

intro.title: Welcome to the HTML Scholar Course
intro.text:
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the backbone of the web. In this module, you will master structural tags, content organization, and basic attributes.

Type 'START' to begin your first interactive lesson.

steps.explain: Every HTML page starts with a Doctype to tell the browser it is HTML5.
The <html> tag is the root of your document. We usually set the language to English.
The <head> contains meta info. UTF-8 ensures all characters display correctly.
The <title> appears in the browser tab. We close the <head> when meta info is done.
The <body> is where your visible content lives. <h1> is a top-level heading.

daily_quests: Build a bulleted list with 3 items
Add an image with alt text

linting.tip: PRO-TIP: Ending a tag? Slashes always come after the opening bracket.
PRO-TIP: 'href' defines the destination of a link.
PRO-TIP: Images are 'self-closing' in most modern HTML standards.
PRO-TIP: The !DOCTYPE tells the browser this is an HTML5 document.
